com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.ui.widget

Class VideoControlsLeanback

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.ui.widget.VideoControls
            • com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.ui.widget.VideoControlsLeanback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, VideoControlsCore

    public class VideoControlsLeanback
extends VideoControls
    Provides playback controls for the VideoView on TV devices.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  VideoControlsLeanback.ButtonFocusChangeListener
      A listener to monitor the selected button and move the ripple indicator when the focus shifts.
      protected class  VideoControlsLeanback.LeanbackInternalListener 
      protected class  VideoControlsLeanback.RemoteKeyListener
      A listener to catch the key events so that we can correctly perform the playback functionality and to hide/show the controls
      protected class  VideoControlsLeanback.RippleTranslateAnimation
      An animation for moving the ripple indicator to the correctly focused view.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void animateVisibility(boolean toVisible)
      Performs the control visibility animation for showing or hiding this view
      void finishLoading()
      Update the controls to indicate that the video is no longer loading which will re-display the play/pause, progress, etc.
      protected void focusNext(android.view.View view)
      Focuses the next visible view specified in the view
      protected void focusPrevious(android.view.View view)
      Focuses the previous visible view specified in the view
      protected int getLayoutResource()
      Used to retrieve the layout resource identifier to inflate
      protected void onAttachedToWindow() 
      protected void onFastForwardClick()
      Performs the functionality to fast forward the current video by 10000 milliseconds.
      protected void onRewindClick()
      Performs the functionality to rewind the current video by 10000 milliseconds.
      protected void performSeek(long seekToTime)
      Performs the functionality to inform any listeners that the video has been seeked to the specified time.
      protected void registerForInput()
      Registers all selectable fields for key events in order to correctly handle navigation.
      protected void registerListeners()
      Registers any internal listeners to perform the playback controls, such as play/pause, next, and previous
      protected void retrieveViews()
      Retrieves the view references from the xml layout
      void setDuration(long duration)
      Sets the video duration in Milliseconds to display at the end of the progress bar
      void setFastForwardButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the button state for the Fast Forward button.
      void setFastForwardButtonRemoved(boolean removed)
      Adds or removes the FastForward button.
      void setFastForwardDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable drawable)
      Sets the drawable for the Fast button
      void setPosition(long position)
      Sets the current video position, updating the seek bar and the current time field
      void setRewindButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the button state for the Rewind button.
      void setRewindButtonRemoved(boolean removed)
      Adds or removes the Rewind button.
      void setRewindDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable drawable)
      Sets the drawable for the rewind button
      protected void setup(android.content.Context context)
      Performs any initialization steps such as retrieving views, registering listeners, and updating any drawables.
      void showLoading(boolean initialLoad)
      Update the controls to indicate that the video is loading.
      protected void showTemporary()
      Temporarily shows the default controls, hiding after the standard delay.
      protected void updateButtonDrawables()
      Updates the drawables used for the buttons to AppCompatTintDrawables
      protected void updateButtonDrawables(int tintList) 
      void updateProgress(long position, long duration, int bufferPercent)
      Performs the progress update on the current time field, and the seek bar
      protected void updateTextContainerVisibility()
      Update the current visibility of the text block independent of the controls visibility

      • setRewindButtonEnabled

        public void setRewindButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from class: VideoControls
        Sets the button state for the Rewind button. This will just change the images specified with VideoControls.setRewindDrawable(Drawable), or use the defaults if they haven't been set

        This method will NOT re-add buttons that have previously been removed with VideoControls.setRewindButtonRemoved(boolean).

        Overrides:
        setRewindButtonEnabled in class VideoControls
        Parameters:
        enabled - If the Rewind button is enabled [default: false]

        This method will NOT re-add buttons that have previously been removed with VideoControls.setFastForwardButtonRemoved(boolean).

        Overrides:
        setFastForwardButtonEnabled in class VideoControls
        Parameters:
        enabled - If the Rewind button is enabled [default: false]

      • showTemporary

        protected void showTemporary()
